page.title: 05Education and South Kyme
page.content: Until September, 1984, pupils attended primary school in South Kyme. Now they travel to Billinghay, beginning the term after their fifth birthday. Selection still operates, so pupils take a 2 part examination. Those passing attend single sex schools in Sleaford; others go to mixed secondary schools:-usually Billinghay Lafford, but sometimes St. Georges, Sleaford, depending upon parental choice, transport and availability of place. Compulsory schooling is now until 16. In the past, many left by 14 and knew only the local school. Learning opportunities and subjects studied were far more limited then. For further education, pupils transfer to Sleaford, or colleges in Lincoln, Grantham or Boston, or universities outside Lincs. Under 5's can use Billinghay playgroup-75p per morning.
